text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, north from West 35th to 36th St's., showing the easterly side of the triangular Herald Building. Occupants at this date include Rogers, Peet & Co. The northerly portion will shortly be razed for a modern office structure. The apex will remain until the Spring of 1940, when it will in turn be demolished. 1939 saw the demolishment of the Sixth Ave. "El" whose shadow appears at the right.

May 15, 1925

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue (across foreground), and vicinity, east side, from W. 35th (right) to 36th (left) Streets, as viewed north-eastward from Macy's Department Store. This area, a part of the former "Satans Circus" is now a portion of Manhattan vast garment center and contains numerous loft and factory structures. Note Keen's Chop House still remaining on the south side of 36th Street, to the east of the Avenue. In the background, dominating the skyline, is the office building, "No. 10 East 40th Street".

February 5, 1929.

P.L. Sperr
